subject: Science
title: Why the Sky Is Blue
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why the Sky Is Blue.

hook.text: Every child asks it. Most adults still can't explain it properly.

buildup.text: Sunlight contains all colors. When it hits the atmosphere, molecules scatter it.

discovery.text: Blue light has a short wavelength, so it scatters more than red or yellow.

twist.text: At sunset, light travels through more atmosphere, scattering blue away â€” leaving red.

climax.text: On the Moon, with no atmosphere, the sky is always black â€” even during the day.

punchline.text: The sky is blue because air is better at scattering short wavelengths.

quiz.question: Why does the sky appear blue?
options: Blue light scatters more than other colors
